column2: moteddybear, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started treatment in Feb of 2008, compleated it in Feb of 2009.  off of it for 2 months and the Hep C came back at the same levels as before I started treatment! restarted treatment in May of 2009. and will go to the end of 2010. depressed, sick, tired and wondering if its worth all this, also major mood swings, My poor family!

column2: imacowgirl47, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Robert, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have takeing peginterferon alfa-2a for 56 weeks and it has worked. I now have no viral load. But side affects for me was fever after weekly injection leg pain/joint pain. I also had mild depression. If i had to choose to take this again i would knowing what i know. What extra time it may give me on this planet with my wife and children is worth all the side affects and then some.So if you need this treatment give it a try you can always stop. But i beleive the benifits out weight the side effects. GOOD LUCK   Robert

I was on this treatment for about four months,in that time i had server side effects my skin on my legs,they started to open up and full with puss and blood and when it bleed my blood was like charcole, i was losing my hair and i about had enought of that medication my doctor was not knowledeg enought to regulate my medication she would call a counsler to see how to treat me and regulate my intake also ask a nurse.And she would make the call,s right in front of me.And one day i said to myself i had enought, on my way to her i had a blackout behind the wheel and i never made to her people got hurt and my life changed in a split second and i will never be the same,my body turned into rubber like mush.My insides fell like there being eating away from the inside out.My ears ring 24hours a day and i,am just sick everyday.

column2: beaks61, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am through with my 48 weeks taking Peg & Ribavirin now for 3 years. And have no detectable C in my body! But one thing I believe is a direct result of taking these Hep C meds, is that I have terriable leg pain in both of my legs. Upper and lower parts. I do have some bulging on my 3rd and 4th disks in my back, which the DR. says is normal for my age. And was wondering if anyone else has this problem AFTER there regime of taking Peg & Ribo? Thank You

column9: It was a 50/50 chance, it worked for me, but it was pure hell. I kept working the entire 52 weeks, lost 70 lbs. lost a lot of hair. Anyone that says they didn`t feel like s*** is lieing ! Its like the worst flu you have ever had 4x over.

column2: Danny, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had good day's and bad I had more bad than good it seemed like.Your back aches so bad I'm bipolar so pegasys really messes with you psycologically with that people around you are affected as well.Aside from the bad side affects peginterferon alfa 2a with ribasphere 52 weeks of treatment and the HEP C 1a really agressive strain is undetectable I'll be back in 4 months to tell you if the HEP C came back or not hope not!

column2: rbmosier, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Started Pegasys Nov. 07 and was undetectable at week 12. I have 20 more weeks of treatment and feel like it has worked for me. I was genotype 1a grade 2 stage 2. Doctor told me I was middle of the road for doing the treatments. I take a shot of peg and a shot of neupogen once a week and 1000mg of ribivarin every day. It's been rough at times but well worth it.
